USER QUERY:
Turn on the bm entrance 3-6g pocker table light to 75% brightness.

To turn on the device named "bm entrance 3-6g pocker table" to 75% brightness, we use the On command [DON] with a parameter specifying the brightness level. The parameter for the On command accepts a range from 0 to 100 percent.

Therefore, the command is:
- Command: On [DON]
- Parameter 1: 75 (Unit: %)
- Parameter range: 0 to 100 %

This will set the light to 75% brightness immediately.
You are a smart home assistant.

USER QUERY:
What is the current status of the leak bm ej pump 2176D3 DRY sensor?

The device "leak bm ej pump 2176D3 DRY" has a Status property that is an enumeration with two possible values: Off [0] and On [100]. This means the status can only be either Off or On.

Since the user asks for the current status, I would check the Status property value. Assuming the current value is known, I would report it. If not, I can only describe the possible values.

The Status property values are:
- Off (0)
- On (100)

Please provide the current Status value to get the exact state. If you want, I can query the device to get the current status.

If you want me to query, I can send the Query [QUERY] command to the device.
You are a smart home assistant.

USER QUERY:
Set the heat setpoint of 25.18.A2 - Main to 72 degrees.

The device "25.18.A2 - Main" supports a Heat Setpoint command [CLISPH] with a parameter range from 0 to 120 degrees.

To set the heat setpoint to 72 degrees, the command details are:
- Command: Heat Setpoint [CLISPH]
- Parameter 1: 72 (Unit: Degrees)
- Parameter range: 0 to 120 Degrees

This will adjust the heating setpoint to 72 degrees as requested.
You are a smart home assistant.

USER QUERY:
What are the available ramp rate options for the lamp posts device?

The device "lamp posts" has a property called Ramp Rate which is an enumeration of various time durations for ramping the light level up or down. The available ramp rate options are:

- 9.0 minutes [0]
- 8.0 minutes [1]
- 7.0 minutes [2]
- 6.0 minutes [3]
- 5.0 minutes [4]
- 4.5 minutes [5]
- 4.0 minutes [6]
- 3.5 minutes [7]
- 3.0 minutes [8]
- 2.5 minutes [9]
- 2.0 minutes [10]
- 1.5 minutes [11]
- 1.0 minute [12]
- 47.0 seconds [13]
- 43.0 seconds [14]
- 38.5 seconds [15]
- 34.0 seconds [16]
- 32.0 seconds [17]
- 30.0 seconds [18]
- 28.0 seconds [19]
- 26.0 seconds [20]
- 23.5 seconds [21]
- 21.5 seconds [22]
- 19.0 seconds [23]
- 8.5 seconds [24]
- 6.5 seconds [25]
- 4.5 seconds [26]
- 2.0 seconds [27]
- 0.5 seconds [28]
- 0.3 seconds [29]
- 0.2 seconds [30]
- 0.1 seconds [31]

These options represent the time it takes for the lamp posts to ramp brightness up or down.
You are a smart home assistant.

USER QUERY:
Set the backlight of 2f bridge E 6bON1g Ubrid ext to On 10 / Off 0.

The device "2f bridge E 6bON1g Ubrid ext" has a Backlight [BL] command that accepts a parameter ranging from 0 to 100 Unit %, with specific indexed values representing combinations of On and Off states.

You requested to set the backlight to "On 10 / Off 0". According to the enumeration, this corresponds to the index [10].

Therefore, the command to send is:
- Command: Backlight [BL]
- Parameter 1: 10 (Unit: %)
- Parameter range: 0 to 100 % (with indexed values as listed)

This will set the backlight to the specified On 10 / Off 0 state.
You are a smart home assistant.

USER QUERY:
Please set the ramp rate of bm restroom 3-3g shower to 1.0 minute.

The device "bm restroom 3-3g shower" has a Ramp Rate property and command [RR] with enumerated values representing various time durations.

The available ramp rate options include 1.0 minute, which corresponds to the enum value [12].

To set the ramp rate to 1.0 minute, the command details are:
- Command: Ramp Rate [RR]
- Parameter 1: 12 (Unit: enum index for 1.0 minute)
- Parameter range: enum values from 0 to 31 representing times from 9.0 minutes down to 0.1 seconds

This command will set the ramp rate to 1.0 minute as requested.
